content:
Try this:

- go to TB menu > Settings > General 

- scroll all the way down and click the 'Config editor' button on the right 
- click 'Accept the risk and continue' 
- search for accessibility.force_disabled > change the value to 1 > click the check mark 
- restart TB

After import of profile (thunderbird import or ImportExportNG) : - all pop and imap accounts are present. - all accounts contain all messages (with body, attachments...). I quit thunderbird. I launch thunderbird. (with the right profile which contains the restored datas : thunderbird -ProfileManager ).

No account is missing (pop or imap) but some accounts have zero folder and zero message (on display, perhaps still into file).

Other accounts have all their emails and folders.

content:
No message is missing into profile accounts backuped.

Here are screenshots to confirm.

To be sure, computer is switched to offline internet connection, so no data retrived from imap servers, only local files are used.

I delete existing profile, create a new profile (thunderbird -ProfileManager)

A ignore first account creation at thunderbird startup.

Then, "Menu/tools/import/import from another thunderbird installation", then "choose profile folder".

I launch import, processing...

Result is on column 1 of screenshot (left column) : You can see a list of several emails accounts. Some have total emails sum, other no sum (but contains emails and folders).

I choose one of account which will loose datas displayed : the yahoo account. You can see column 2 all folders restored, trash contains 1300+ emails, ...

All accounts are restored, emails and folders, I can read offline stored emails without internet connection enabled, all is perfect (except some account with sum count regenerated);

So, now, I quit thunderbird (menu/quit), nothing else.

I launch thunderbird.

You can see Column 3, yahoo acount deployed : now only one folder "inbox" ("courrier entrant" in french language), no message (message list empty on the right : black background) into inbox folder, all disapear.

Same results if I use ImportExportNG instead of Thunderbird import function.

I suppose instead import function I can't try to use direct remplace/copy of profiles folders into data folders, because the backup is an older thunderbird version (no error during the successfull import displayed).
creator: Traped

content: Your screenshots were not included. My inference is that your IMAP accounts are not signed in. IMAP accounts always sync to the server, not to the PC. So, if you have messages on PC and access an IMAP account that does not access the actual account, IMAP logic is to make the local folder match the online folder. Since the online folder is empty, the local messages are deleted. I suggest you use your online access to the account to verify that there are messages there. Then, when you actually log in with the IMAP account, messages will appear.
creator: davidsk

content:
The screeshot was updated during you replyed to me. Sorry. You can see it now.

Outside this question, when I used thunderbird Offline mode, it didn't destroyed my local downloaded copy of server emails and I can use thunderbird offline to read my emails.

So I am not sure this may be the reason.

And I tryed to setup, after a successfull import, thunderbird to permanent offline mode before restart it, to disabled server attempts.
creator: Traped

content: True, if you stay offline you can read messages, but if you go online, thunderbird will attempt to retrieve messages. If it fails, the messages in account folders will be deleted. If the account no longer exists, I suggest that you copy the messages to Local Folders and then delete the account.
creator: davidsk

content:
A quando risale l'ulltimo backup? Inoltre, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: There is no limit on local storage. If messages are missing, you might try clicking help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profiles' and clck 'about:profiles and then browse any profiles listed. Local folders would be in the Mail\Local Folders folder of a profile. Otherwise, I am at a loss of where your messages might be.

content: If you want to receive emails on your PC and mobile and read them on both devices, you will need to use IMAP on all of your devices. POP should only be used if you only want to access your emails on a single device.

content:
Try:

  1. Right-click trash folder → "Repair Folder" → wait for sync to complete.
  2. If "Empty Trash" option still missing: Right-click trash folder → Properties → General tab → Check "When getting new messages for this account, always check this folder" → OK.

Then try right-clicking trash again - the "Empty Trash" option should reappear.
creator: jay.s1

content:
If the temp password works to access AOL webmail, you should use it when the (OAuth2) browser-like window appears on first connection, asking to allow TB access to the account. Check that you have these settings:

incoming: imap.aol.com, 993, SSL/TLS, OAuth2 authentication, email address

outgoing: smtp.aol.com, 465, SSL/TLS, OAuth2 authentication, email address

and that cookies are accepted in TB (not browser) Settings/Privacy & Security.

content: Thunderbird has no rules. My personal recommendation is that length trumps complexity. For example, the password of 'bestfriendBill' is more complex to hack than '#7Ab$%' - I suggest creating passwords that are subsets of sentences, as you can remember those.

content:
Yes, it's safe, but I always recommend doing backups prior to major updates. BACKUP

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media or another place on hard drive
creator: davidsk

content:
Because 142.0 has been released, I will say that it has been tested. However since it's still pretty new, you might be safer to upgrade to 140.2esr, which has been out longer and has proven to be stable.

Basic functionality of all versions should be good. The thing to watch out for is if your extensions are compatible with newer versions. As I recall, some significant architecture changes were made since ver. 128. There is an add-on called "Add-on compatibility check" that can tell you if your current add-on will work with later releases:

https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/addon-compatibility-check/

Before upgrading, I recommend making a backup copy of your profile, in case it doesn't work out and you need to downgrade.
